newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: FOCUS - Portugal gets 136 bln escudos from BFE sale.
newsitem.headline: FOCUS - Portugal gets 136 bln escudos from BFE sale.

text.p: The Portuguese government will raise 136 billion escudos ($898 million) from its sale of 65 percent of Banco de Fomento e Exterior (BFE) to Banco Portugues de Investimento (BPI), the Lisbon bourse said on Wednesday.
The bourse said BPI had offered 2,615 escudos per share, higher than share dealers had expected.
Shares in BFE were suspended last week at 2,545 escudos amid speculation over what price BPI had paid.

Dealers expected the stock to rise when the trading suspension was lifted at 1100 GMT but said it would not go much above 2,550 escudos. BPI shares, which were last quoted at 2,115 escudos, were expected to fall.
Portuguese Finance Minister Antonio Sousa Franco said last week that Portugal would raise far more than the initially forecast 380 billion escudos from privatisations this year.
He gave no fresh forecast but said that with two major privatisations in the bag and two others in preparation, the goal would be comfortably exceeded.

The BPI-SGPS holding company said after the price announcement that it would raise its capital by 30 billion escudos for shareholders and issue a further 30 billion escudos of preferential non-voting shares. BPI-SGPS's capital currently stands at 56.45 billion escudos.
It said the increases would take place over the next six months.
